page.title: 02NATIONAL TRUST
page.content:
NATIONAL TRUST IN SILVERDALE
Silverdale is situated in a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and the National Trust has been given a number of sites and properties within the village.
Eaves Wood and more recently Jubilee Wood consist mainly of an area of beech wood together with many other varieties of trees, shrubs and plants that thrive on limestone.
Bank Farm, in the centre of the village, has a typical north Lancashire range of buildings and has land running down to the sea.
